1.1.1.1.3.1.1. shapepipe.modules.combine_mexp_package.combine_mexp_script module¶

TILEOBJ_AS_EXP_SCRIPT

This script contains a class to handle processing for the combine_mexp_script module: Combine information on objects and PSF from multiple exposure-single-CCD catalogues.

Author

Martin Kilbinger <martin.kilbinger@cea.fr>

Date

February 2019

Version

1.0

exception shapepipe.modules.combine_mexp_package.combine_mexp_script.CombineMExpError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Generic error that is raised by this script.

class shapepipe.modules.combine_mexp_package.combine_mexp_script.combine_mexp(input_file_names, output_dir, image_number, config, w_log)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for combining multiple exposure-single-CCD catalogue and PSF information.

Parameters

  • input_file_name (list of 2 string) – path to input files, [image, catalogue]

  • config (config class) – config file content

  • output_dir (string) – output directory

  • image_number (string) – image number for input tile according to numbering scheme from config file

  • w_log (log file class) – log file

Returns

Return type

None

process()[source]¶
combine_information(exp_CCD_cat_list, psf_list)[source]¶

Combine galaxy and PSF information.

Parameters

  • exp_CCD_list (list of strings) – exposure-single-CCD catalogue base names

  • psf_list (list of strings) – PSF vignet file base names

Returns

combined_data – combined exposure-single-CCD and PSF data covering the tile

Return type

FITS_rec

Save data to file.

Parameters

  • data (FITS_rec) – catalogue data

  • outcat_pattern (string) – output catalogue file name pattern

Returns

Parameters

check_consistency(indices, nexp)[source]¶

Check consistency of multi-exposure galaxy data

Parameters

  • indices (numpy array of int) – list of indices

  • nexp (int) – number of exposures

Returns

result – True if consistent

Return type

bool

select_one(data, indices)[source]¶

Select galaxy according to multi-exposure information.

Parameters

  • data (numpy array) – galaxy and PSF data

  • indices (numpy array of int) – indices of corresponding to the same object from different exposures

Returns

is_gal, params_out – True if object is selected as galaxy

Return type

bool

combine_exp_psf(exp_cat_data, exp_cat_cols, psf_data, psf_cols)[source]¶
Return data array with combined information from exposure-

single-CCD and PSF.

Parameters

  • exp_cat_data (FITS_rec) – exposure-single-CCD data

  • exp_cols (array of string) – exposure-single-CCD column names

  • psf_data (FITS_rec) – PSF data

  • psf_cols (array of string) – PSF column names

Returns

exp_cat_data_plut – exposure-single-CCD and PSF joined data

Return type

FITS_rec

Parameters

  • base_name (string) – file base name

  • ext (string) – file extension

Returns

cat – file content

get_exposure_list()[source]¶
Return list of exposure file used for the tile in process, from tiles FITS header

MKDEBUG: Note: this function is identical to the find_exposures class routine

Returns

exp_list_uniq – list of exposure basenames

Return type

list of string

get_exp_CCD_cat_and_PSF_list(n_exp)[source]¶
Return lists of exposure-single-CCD catalogue file base names and

PSF vignet file base names. MKDEBUG note: This function is identical to the tileob_as_exp class routine.

Parameters

n_exp (int) – number of exposures

Returns

  • exp_CCD_list (list of strings) – exposure-single-CCD catalogue base names

  • psf_list (list of strings) – PSF vignet file base names
